h2.strong: Marion County School District School Closure Information and Resources

div.p:
**SCHOOL CLOSURE INFORMATION**
The Marion County School District buldings are closed for the remainder of the year, but distance learning at home continues through the 2019-2020 school year. Students official final day is May 22, 2020.
Please check back for updated information.

div.a: Health Updates from Superintendent Wendy Bracey

div.class: et_pb_column et_pb_column_1_3 et_pb_column_6 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child et_pb_column_empty

div.div: The following links provide important health information concerning the COVID-19 virus and what students can do to protect themselves from it.

div.a: Mississippi Department of Health COVID-19 Portal

div.div: Mississippi Department of Education COVID-19 Portal

div.a: U.S. Department of Education COVID-19 Portal

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_image et_pb_image_2 et_animated et-waypoint

iframe.title: Coronavirus FAQ: Why Is Hand-Washing Important?

div.p: Our school district has been using Clever for the last several years in preparation for online learning. All of the resources your child uses on our school computers are available to them at home. Use the link below to access Clever with your student’s Marion County School District login. If your child is K-3 it is possible they do not know their login. Your school will be sending out information to you to help your child access Clever and continue their learning at home.

div.a: If you would like to add your business/location to the list of free WiFi hotspots for our students please send your business name and address to [email protected]
